items.title: Apple takes control of all core chips in iPhone Air with new architecture to prioritize AI
items.excerpt: iPhone Air is the big newcomer among Apple 's latest lineup that went on sale Friday, but inside the slim phone's raised plateau is another new piece of hardware that signals a renewed focus on artificial intelligence.

items.title: NBA star Kevin Durant can't unlock his Coinbase bitcoin account. His agent is thrilled
items.excerpt: NBA superstar Kevin Durant can't find the password to his Coinbase account, which holds bitcoin that he began buying in earnest when he was playing for the Golden State Warriors in 2016. His agent couldn't be happier.

items.title: Google adds Gemini to Chrome for all users in push to bolster AI search
items.excerpt: Google is adding more artificial intelligence into its Chrome browser as the search giant tries to fend off burgeoning competition from AI startups OpenAI and Perplexity .

items.title: AI startup Nscale came out of nowhere and is blowing away Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang
items.excerpt: Two years ago, Nscale was a brand new startup in the U.K. that had yet to raise any outside funding or officially announce its existence.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Huang says $5 billion stake in rival Intel will be 'an incredible investment'
items.excerpt: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said that the company's $5 billion investment and technology collaboration with Intel comes after the two companies held discussions for nearly a year.

items.title: Notion rides AI boom to $500 million in annual revenue, but Microsoft competition looms
items.excerpt: OpenAI's public launch of ChatGPT in November 2022 is widely viewed as the event that kicked off the generative AI boom, which remains the dominant theme in the tech industry almost three years later.

items.title: Netskope soars 18% on first day of trading, reaches $8.6 billion market cap
items.excerpt: Netskope jumped more than 18% in its Nasdaq debut on Thursday, pushing the cybersecurity firm to $8.6 billion in market value.

items.title: Microsoft to spend $4 billion on second Wisconsin data center
items.excerpt: RACINE, Wis. — Microsoft said Thursday that it will allocate $4 billion to build a second data center in Wisconsin. The first one will come online in early 2026, with the software company spending $3.3 billion on it.

items.title: Meta product chief Chris Cox says smart glasses are the future of computing
items.excerpt: Meta Chief Product Officer Chris Cox said on Thursday that smart glasses are the future of computing devices.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg unveils $799 Meta Ray-Ban Display glasses
items.excerpt: Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday unveiled the $799 Meta Ray-Ban Display glasses, the social media company's first consumer-ready smart glasses with a built-in display.

items.title: How robotic beehives use AI to protect bees from climate change
items.excerpt: Bees are critical for ensuring an abundant food supply year-round, but the bee population is in big trouble.

items.title: Deliveroo founder Will Shu to step down as CEO after DoorDash takeover
items.excerpt: LONDON — Deliveroo CEO Will Shu is set to step down from the food delivery company he co-founded over a decade ago.

items.title: Cold shoulder: Why Beijing is freezing Nvidia's access to the Chinese market
items.excerpt: Beijing has reportedly halted purchases of yet another AI chip from Nvidia, freezing it out of the market completely — a move industry experts say reflects the country's growing confidence in domestic chip makers and an attempt at gaining trade leverage.

items.title: Coinbase CEO says banks are fighting stablecoin rewards with 'boogeyman' issues
items.excerpt: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong and other crypto executives took to Capitol Hill this week as part of a regulatory showdown between the industry and banks with potentially trillions at stake.

items.title: Workday stock climbs as activist investor Elliott takes $2 billion stake
items.excerpt: Shares of Workday closed up 7% on Wednesday at $234.88 after activist investor Elliott Investment Management announced a $2 billion stake in the company.

items.title: Ten years after selling Periscope to Twitter, startup's co-founder raises $40 million for Macroscope
items.excerpt: It's been a decade since Kayvon Beykpour sold Periscope to Twitter for a reported $100 million, allowing the social media site to jump into livestreaming.

items.title: StubHub slides 6% in NYSE debut after ticket seller's long-awaited IPO
items.excerpt: StubHub shares dropped 6.4% in their New York Stock Exchange debut on Wednesday after the online ticket seller priced its initial public offering in the middle of its expected range.

items.title: StubHub CEO says recent change to all-in ticket prices will dent revenue
items.excerpt: StubHub CEO Eric Baker said Wednesday that recently introduced federal regulations around transparent ticket pricing will cause a "one-time" hit to its financial results.

items.title: Netskope prices IPO at $19, valuing company at $7.3 billion
items.excerpt: Cybersecurity company Netskope is eying a $7.3 billion valuation after pricing shares at $19 for its upcoming IPO, at the top end of its expected range.

items.title: Lyft shares pop on Waymo deal to bring robotaxis to Nashville next year
items.excerpt: Waymo has partnered with Uber to get its robotaxis into Atlanta and Austin, Texas. Now it's teaming up with Lyft for the first time in a commercial deal to enter Nashville next year.

items.title: Amazon introduces AI agent to help sellers with tedious tasks
items.excerpt: Amazon on Wednesday introduced an artificial intelligence agent that will help third-party merchants operate their online businesses.
